text:
Curious to the developers in the room & product team… a complaint I receive occasionally is that there are *no error messages for hubl* so it take 10x longer to find issues than with every other programming language.  
 > Any suggested resources / processes for a developer frustrated by time spent finding/solving an issue in HubL?
 > Is there any roadmap item I can comfort the team with?
There are errors…
if there are template errors.
it wont let you save the file and if there are template errors once you have saved you are supposed to be able to see them in dev mode.
&hsDebug=True
add that to a page url
^^^^^ WTF IS THIS MAGIC
sorry…
is there some sort of documentation for this that just isn't shown anywhere
&hsDebug=True if with other items ?hsDebug=True if by itself at the end of a url
well of course - standard querystringing
But how did you learn about this... what else have they been hiding from us
lol..
super interesting for optimizing HubL functions that may be running on pages
with the request / processing time
<http://designers.HubSpot.com/blog/5-common-questions-answers-about-developing-on-the-cos>
but i have known about it for a while
Yea I didnt know about this till I asked and I think <@U25PYL3Q8> told me about it
Supper useful for debugging.. un minifies the js and css too.
Glad we could help

It'd be awesome if HS also documented some things you can do with Jinja as well. Like I know I was able to use:
```
    {% if authors_choice.append("[\""+author+"\",\""+author+"\"]") == 'true' %}{% endif %}

```
and overall, was able to pull a list of authors for a dropdown option. Though the `.append()` is a jinja part
Hubl is just a jinja port to Java to 99% of things do work. Plus much more that wasnt in Jinja
True, I just wish they expanded on some nice Jinja stuff so I knew what I could and couldn't use.
